title: Arman Daniel Catterson [website version]
text: I teach statistics and psychology at Diablo Valley College (as a professor with my own office and health insurance and tenure) and UC Berkeley (as a continuing lecturer who is not required to attend meetings or serve on committees). Thank you for visiting my webpage.

title: Arman Daniel Catterson [website version]
text:
Wave hi if you see me on campus
Talk to me after class
E-mail me using the address in our course syllabus.

Professor | Arman Daniel Catterson, PhD [he / his / ÿßŸà ] üê±(catterson@berkeley.edu)

Lectures : Fridays 9:00 - 12:00 PM in 1213 Berkeley Way West
Office Hours : Mondays 10:30 - 11:30 AM on Zoom (e-mail / chat after class to find another time)

Teaching Assistant | Sierra Semko Krouse [she / her] | sierra_semko@berkeley.edu

Sections : Fridays, 1:00 - 2:00 PM in 1213 Berkeley Way West
Office Hours : Wednesdays 2:00 - 3:00 PM via Zoom (click here to sign-up for a 15-minute slot)

Grade Details. Your grade in the class will be based on the following components. (Letter grades will be based on the following : A+ is > 96.5; A is > 92.5; A- is > 89.5; etc. Note that an 89.49999 is a B+.)









10% Attendance
30% R Exams [10 + 20]
10% Article Presentations


20% Lab Assignments
20% Final Project
10% Article Discussions

title: Psych 205 - Lab 1
text:
The goal of this lab is to get more practice working in R and R Markdown, and practice loading (and evaluating) datasets.


We will work on these questions together in lecture.

Define a variable














Look over the supplemental readings for instructions on how to load a dataset from a .csv file. Load each of the four datasets posted to our ‚ÄúDatasets‚Äù folder.
